Incident.Summary: The suspect was involved in a motor vehicle collision, left the scene, and was under the influence of alcohol.

AddressCommonName.CommonPlaceName: 5900-5948 BALLENGER CREEK PIKE / 300-306 BALLENGER CENTER DR
0-0 BALLENGER CREEK PIKE / 300-306 BALLENGER CENTER DR

IncidentSuppNarrative.NarrativeText: B-9, ST Hopkins #6060 // BWC and MVR available B-11, TFC Piskor #6225 // BWC available Sgt Redman #459 // BWC available DFC Leith #587 // BWC available *Maryland State Police Frederick Barrack* font-variant-ligatures:normal; text-decoration-thickness:initial; text-decoration-style:initial; text-decoration-color:initial" /> Date/Time of Arrest: 11/16/2023 @ 0956 hours font-variant-ligatures:normal; text-decoration-thickness:initial; text-decoration-style:initial; text-decoration-color:initial" /> Defendant:Kyle Robert Gordon Date of Birth: 8/23/1985 font-variant-ligatures:normal; text-decoration-thickness:initial; text-decoration-style:initial; text-decoration-color:initial" /> font-variant-ligatures:normal; text-decoration-color:initial; text-decoration-style:initial; text-decoration-thickness:initial">TRAINING/CERTIFICATES font-variant-ligatures:normal; text-decoration-thickness:initial; text-decoration-style:initial; text-decoration-color:initial" /> I am trained and certified by the Maryland State Police and the National Highway Traffic Safety Administration to administer standardized field sobriety tests, and Advanced Roadside Impairment Driving Enforcement. font-variant-ligatures:normal; text-decoration-thickness:initial; text-decoration-style:initial; text-decoration-color:initial" /> font-variant-ligatures:normal; text-decoration-thickness:initial; text-decoration-style:initial; text-decoration-color:initial" /> font-variant-ligatures:normal">VEHICLE IN MOTION (PHASE 1) font-variant-ligatures:normal; text-decoration-thickness:initial; text-decoration-style:initial; text-decoration-color:initial" /> On 11/16/2023 at approximately 0956 hours, I was dispatched to respond to MD Route 351 (Ballenger Creek Pike) and the area of Ballenger Center Drive, for the report of a motor vehicle collision. font-variant-ligatures:normal; text-decoration-thickness:initial; text-decoration-style:initial; text-decoration-color:initial" /> When I arrived on scene, I contacted several Frederick County Deputies who were on scene with a motorist. I spoke with Deputy First Class Leith #587, of the Frederick County Sheriffs Office. DFC Leith advised that he had stopped a vehicle that was apparently attempting to leave the scene of a collision after he was flagged down by several vehicles stopped on Ballenger Creek Pike at Crestwood Boulevard. DFC Leith advised that he had stopped the vehicle, identified as a gray Chevrolet Trax bearing Maryland registration 6FP1240 and contacted the operator, identified as Kyle Robert Gordon, 8/23/1985. DFC Leith advised that he detected a very strong odor of an alcoholic beverage on Gordons breath and person. When Gordon was asked how many alcoholic beverages he consumed, he indicated that he had quite a bit. DFC Leith also noted that Gordon was wearing a hospital gown. Gordon had a severe head injury from the collision so medics were summoned to the scene for a check-up. font-variant-ligatures:normal; text-decoration-thickness:initial; text-decoration-style:initial; text-decoration-color:initial" /> PERSONAL CONTACT (PHASE 2) font-variant-ligatures:normal; text-decoration-thickness:initial; text-decoration-style:initial; text-decoration-color:initial" /> I did not have any immediate direct contact with Gordon, and due to his suspected serious injuries, he was left in the care of the paramedics on scene for treatment. Gordon was transported to Frederick Health Hospital for treatment. Due to the suspected alcohol impairment, I responded to FHH to request a blood draw. PRE-ARREST SCREENING (PHASE 3) font-variant-ligatures:normal; text-decoration-thickness:initial; text-decoration-style:initial; text-decoration-color:initial" /> Gordon was not requested to complete any Standardized Field Sobriety Testing due to his injuries. HORIZONTAL GAZE NYSTAGMUS(0/6 clues observed) font-variant-ligatures:normal; text-decoration-thickness:initial; text-decoration-style:initial; text-decoration-color:initial" /> Gordon was not requested to complete any Standardized Field Sobriety Testing due to his injuries. font-variant-ligatures:normal; text-decoration-thickness:initial; text-decoration-style:initial; text-decoration-color:initial" /> WALK AND TURN(0/8 clues observed) font-variant-ligatures:normal; text-decoration-thickness:initial; text-decoration-style:initial; text-decoration-color:initial" /> Gordon was not requested to complete any Standardized Field Sobriety Testing due to his injuries. ONE LEG STAND(0/4 clues observed) font-variant-ligatures:normal; text-decoration-thickness:initial; text-decoration-style:initial; text-decoration-color:initial" /> Gordon was not requested to complete any Standardized Field Sobriety Testing due to his injuries. ARREST/PROCESSING font-variant-ligatures:normal; text-decoration-thickness:initial; text-decoration-style:initial; text-decoration-color:initial" /> Based on the following, I had reason to believe Gordon was driving a motor vehicle while impaired by an alcoholic beverage. font-variant-ligatures:normal; text-decoration-thickness:initial; text-decoration-style:initial; text-decoration-color:initial" /> font-variant-ligatures:normal; text-decoration-thickness:initial; text-decoration-style:initial; text-decoration-color:initial" /> * Gordon being involved in a motor vehicle collision. font-variant-ligatures:normal; text-decoration-thickness:initial; text-decoration-style:initial; text-decoration-color:initial" /> * Strong odor of an alcoholic beverage on his breath and person. font-variant-ligatures:normal; text-decoration-thickness:initial; text-decoration-style:initial; text-decoration-color:initial" /> * Gordon admitting to drinking alcoholic beverages. font-variant-ligatures:normal; text-decoration-thickness:initial; text-decoration-style:initial; text-decoration-color:initial" /> * Presence of open containers and partially consumed alcoholic beverages. font-variant-ligatures:normal; text-decoration-thickness:initial; text-decoration-style:initial; text-decoration-color:initial" /> I met with Gordon at Frederick Health Hospital in the triage area. I detected an overpowering odor of alcohol on his breath and person, noting his eyes were very glassy. I observed Gordon to have a large bruise and bump on his forehead. I spoke with Gordon briefly about the collision, and provided him the information exchange form. I read Gordon the DR-15, Advice of Rights form, which he agreed to submit to the blood draw. At approximately 1125 hours, Amy Downes, a nurse with Frederick Health Hospital, performed a blood draw from Gordon. I witnessed the draw and collected the blood samples which I packaged, and shipped to FSD in accordance with MSP policies and procedures. I provided Gordon his copy of the DR-15, and released him to the care of hospital staff at this time. Gordon indicated that he was going through a divorce and became very depressed, so he began drinking heavily. Gordon pleaded for some resources that could help him with his alcohol problem, so I provided him a few resources to get him started. font-variant-ligatures:normal; text-decoration-thickness:initial; text-decoration-style:initial; text-decoration-color:initial" /> All events occurred in Frederick County, Maryland. font-variant-ligatures:normal; text-decoration-thickness:initial; text-decoration-style:initial; text-decoration-color:initial" /> font-variant-ligatures:normal; text-decoration-thickness:initial; text-decoration-style:initial; text-decoration-color:initial" /> font-variant-ligatures:normal; text-decoration-thickness:initial; text-decoration-style:initial; text-decoration-color:initial" /> CASE CLOSED
